intro: Savia andringitrana, commonly known as the Madagascar milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its milky latex is a characteristic feature, often used in traditional medicine. Savia andringitrana is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
